Description: SWE-bench Pro evaluates software engineering agents on a large set of real-world GitHub issues that require understanding a repository, implementing a correct patch, and passing tests under a standardized harness. Compared to earlier SWE-bench variants, it is designed to be more challenging and more resistant to superficial pattern matching by emphasizing realistic workflows and broader language coverage.
Cognitive Functions: Planning, Adaptive Error Correction, Logical Reasoning, Working Memory, Language Comprehension (minor)

Description: OSWorld measures an agent’s ability to operate a computer through a graphical desktop environment, completing multi-step tasks across applications (e.g., settings, file management, web, productivity tools). Success requires perceiving screenshots/UI state, choosing actions such as clicks/typing, and recovering from errors under step limits.
Cognitive Functions: Visual Perception, Scene Understanding & Visual Reasoning, Sensorimotor Coordination, Planning, Decision-making, Visual Attention & Eye Movements (minor), Adaptive Error Correction (minor)

Description: ARC-AGI tests few-shot abstract reasoning on grid-based tasks where a model must infer a hidden transformation rule from a handful of examples and apply it to a new input. It is designed to emphasize novel pattern induction and compositional generalization rather than memorized domain knowledge.
Cognitive Functions: Logical Reasoning, Cognitive Flexibility, Working Memory, Spatial Representation & Mapping, Visual Perception (minor), Scene Understanding & Visual Reasoning

Description: Vending-Bench 2 evaluates long-horizon agent coherence and decision quality in a simulated year-long vending machine business, starting from a fixed budget. Agents must handle repeated, interdependent business decisions (inventory, pricing, supplier negotiation/communication) over thousands of steps to maximize final balance.
Cognitive Functions: Planning, Decision-making, Working Memory, Reward Mechanisms, Adaptive Error Correction (minor), Language Production (minor), Semantic Understanding & Context Recognition (minor)

Description: MCP-Atlas evaluates real-world tool use via the Model Context Protocol by testing whether models can discover appropriate tools, invoke them correctly, handle errors/retries, and synthesize results across multi-step workflows. Tasks resemble production integrations where correctness depends on both API interaction fidelity and correct final reasoning.
Cognitive Functions: Planning, Decision-making, Working Memory, Adaptive Error Correction, Language Comprehension (minor), Language Production (minor)

Description: CyberGym evaluates cybersecurity agent capabilities on real vulnerabilities at scale, including finding known vulnerabilities from descriptions and discovering previously unknown issues in open-source codebases. The benchmark emphasizes realistic security workflows: code comprehension, hypothesis-driven testing, and producing actionable vulnerability reports or patches.
Cognitive Functions: Logical Reasoning, Planning, Adaptive Error Correction, Working Memory, Semantic Understanding & Context Recognition (minor), Language Comprehension (minor)

Description: Humanity’s Last Exam (HLE) is a broad, frontier difficulty benchmark with thousands of questions spanning advanced academic knowledge and reasoning, including multimodal items. It aims to stress-test cross-domain problem solving under limited attempts, often separating “no-tools” reasoning from search/tool-enabled settings in some evaluations.
Cognitive Functions: Language Comprehension, Logical Reasoning, Semantic Understanding & Context Recognition, Working Memory, Visual Perception (minor), Scene Understanding & Visual Reasoning (minor)

Description: GPQA Diamond is a high-quality subset of graduate-level, “Google-proof” multiple-choice science questions where non-experts tend to fail while experts succeed. It targets deep scientific reasoning and careful reading under adversarially difficult distractors, with limited benefit from shallow memorization.
Cognitive Functions: Logical Reasoning, Language Comprehension, Working Memory, Semantic Understanding & Context Recognition

Description: MMMU-Pro is a professional-level multimodal benchmark spanning many disciplines where models must answer questions grounded in images (diagrams, charts, UI screenshots, scientific figures) and accompanying text. It is designed to probe expert reasoning beyond basic recognition by requiring multi-step interpretation and domain knowledge integration.
Cognitive Functions: Visual Perception, Scene Understanding & Visual Reasoning, Multisensory Integration, Language Comprehension, Logical Reasoning, Working Memory (minor)

Description: OmniDocBench 1.5 evaluates document understanding and OCR in complex, real-world layouts, including text, tables, formulas, and reading order. It stresses end-to-end document parsing where correct outputs depend on spatial layout interpretation as much as character-level transcription.
Cognitive Functions: Visual Perception, Visual Attention & Eye Movements, Spatial Representation & Mapping, Language Comprehension (minor), Scene Understanding & Visual Reasoning

Description: Video-MMMU evaluates multimodal understanding over videos, requiring models to answer questions that depend on events unfolding over time (actions, causal sequences, temporal details) alongside textual context. It targets long-range temporal integration rather than single-frame recognition.
Cognitive Functions: Visual Perception, Cognitive Timing & Predictive Modeling, Working Memory, Scene Understanding & Visual Reasoning, Language Comprehension (minor), Attention (minor)

Description: LiveCodeBench Pro evaluates coding ability on competitively designed tasks that require producing correct programs, often under interactive or execution-based judging. It emphasizes reliable algorithmic problem solving, debugging, and robustness rather than single-shot code synthesis without feedback.
Cognitive Functions: Logical Reasoning, Planning, Adaptive Error Correction, Working Memory, Language Production (minor)

Description: The FACTS Benchmark Suite systematically evaluates factuality in language model outputs across multiple settings, focusing on whether generated statements are supported by evidence and remain consistent with provided context. It targets hallucination-related failure modes and distinguishes different kinds of factual errors rather than using a single coarse score.
Cognitive Functions: Semantic Understanding & Context Recognition, Language Production, Working Memory (minor), Inhibitory Control (minor)

Description: Global PIQA evaluates multilingual physical commonsense reasoning by asking questions about everyday interactions with the physical world and plausible actions/outcomes across many languages. It probes whether models retain consistent intuitive physics and pragmatic affordance understanding beyond English-centric training distributions.
Cognitive Functions: Language Comprehension, Logical Reasoning, Semantic Understanding & Context Recognition, Spatial Representation & Mapping (minor), Cognitive Flexibility (minor)

Description: MRCR v2 is a long-context, multi-round co-reference and retrieval benchmark where multiple similar “needle” requests are embedded in long “haystacks,” and the model must reproduce the correct response for a specified needle. The 8-needle variant stresses maintaining accurate referential bindings and resisting interference across very long contexts.
Cognitive Functions: Working Memory, Attention, Language Comprehension, Episodic Memory (minor)

Description: GDPval evaluates well-specified professional knowledge-work tasks spanning many occupations, where models produce real work products (e.g., spreadsheets, slides, schedules, analyses) and are judged side-by-side against human professionals. It targets practical task completion quality, including adherence to constraints, clarity, and usefulness under realistic deliverable formats.
Cognitive Functions: Planning, Decision-making, Language Production, Semantic Understanding & Context Recognition, Working Memory (minor), Social Reasoning & Theory of Mind (minor)

Description: SWE-Lancer evaluates software engineering performance on tasks that more closely resemble end-to-end development work, including implementing changes across codebases and meeting specification/acceptance criteria. It emphasizes reliability in producing correct patches and coordinating multi-step engineering actions rather than isolated coding puzzles.
Cognitive Functions: Planning, Adaptive Error Correction, Logical Reasoning, Working Memory, Language Comprehension (minor)

Description: FrontierMath measures advanced mathematical problem solving on difficult, expert-level items, often requiring multi-step derivations, careful symbolic manipulation, and nontrivial insight. It is designed to reduce contamination and to more faithfully reflect genuine progress on hard math rather than memorized contest solutions.
Cognitive Functions: Logical Reasoning, Working Memory, Planning (minor), Cognitive Flexibility (minor)
